intro: Spathandra lutescens, commonly known as the golden spathandra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. Spathandra lutescens prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
